page.title: 16RUSKINGTON PAST AND PRESENT3
page.content:
cuts gentlemen's hair at this address. On Lincoln Road, by the allotments, a gravel-pit was located, close by is the site of an Anglo-Saxon burial ground (see text page 5). From this point one used to be able to walk through open fields to the junction of Millview Road and Westgate using stepping stones to climb over fences. Post-war prefabricated buildings were the first structures to appear on this site in 1950, since then it has grown into a large council estate. In 1960, 14, Westgate was trans- formed into a ladies hairdressing salon called "Daphne's". Daphne later extended into 16, Westgate, a four hundred year old timber framed building constructed of lathe and plaster, mud and stud. Sadly, this
